comment: Wonderfully smokey smell, with a good and balanced taste. Great  introduction for new whisky drinkers to the Islays
High amount of peat, very smokey.   Full of flavor and the smoke just fills your pallet.  A whiskey for slow sipping and telling stories
Good value Islay malt.  Little bit to smoky.
Whisky très très tourbé. Il peut surprendre la première fois, mais on y revient pas nostalgie
Smoky, smoky ,smoky.  It's a one trick pony, but wow, what a trick it is.
A very nice young dram, heavy smoke and iodine on the nose with a beautiful sweet floral palette, long finish of fruit and smoke.
Considerably young and sharp, yet good value for money. Homeless man by the nose, less peaty, with fruity and sweet finish.
Really enjoy this Scotch. Not overpowering smoke still strong. Heard the rumor that this Ardbeg under different name.
Peat is lighter than the bottle conveys. Smooth with strong iodine notes. Unsure of age but it seems it's in need of maturity.

I'm still starting out in the world of scotches (just had my first bottle of Laphroig). That being said I was really happy with how this went down. Smoky but not like inhaling a campfire and one of the smoothest I've had. Definitely worth the money for this one!
Deep smoke essence. Very light body. Barely all the flavors generated by the smoke.
My favorite thus far. Not too pricy. Tons of smoke, peat and salty air.
I love peaty scotch, but in this one, the peat is all you taste. If you like over peaty scotch, you might like it.
Young but characterless whisky. Indeed, it is a one trick pony. The taste is not very complex, it's just smoke, smoke, smoke. Simple, but does the trick it you want cheap smoke.
If you are a fan of the peaty...here you go...also reasonable at around $60
Liked this pretty well until I put it up against Lagavulin Double Matured. This good but lacks a ton of character and finesse. It's the Beastie Boys against the Rolling Stones.
This peat takes you in unexplored territory. Very well done for an independent bottling. Gorgeous design as a bonus.
Smoke on the nose. Smoke on the tongue. Spicy finish.  Not very good

False advertisement. The labeling and description makes you think it's gonna be SUPER peaty, but it's not. On same level as a bowmore 12 I'd say. It's really thin and watery, not creamy at all. Quite disappointing actually. But for the money I payed $40 cad it's on par with its competitors, so 3/5.

Edit: I'm tasting this back to back with the ARDBEG 10, gotta say one isn't better than the other. Smokehead is more brash while the ARDBEG 10 is more refined. However Smolehead is a lot sweeter than the ARDBEG 10 though
Strong iodine nose, surprisingly lightweight, but smooth, nice lingering finish. Clearly young. Not unpleasant, but why would you when an ardbeg 10 does everything you need.
Bought retail not the one listed mine is Smokehead Islam Single Malt Scot h Whisky 43%, with a black Background label.

Nose vanilla, peat and some bacon upfront and some sort of tarmac comes through. The taste starts with sweet vanilla a distinct alcohol burn takes you to a metal youthfulness and a bitter smokey finish which is a sprinter and fades very quickly. Only a unpleasant bitterness sticks to your mouth for quite some time. The balance of this whisky is rather off and all in all it is by far not my favourite dram. Not recommended.

Not a bad little islay Scotch.....  It's young the balance is a little off. I like the white pepper kick. The peat and smoke notes are awesome. Some people say it's a 6 year ardbeg.... Seems about right.
Bitch, bitch please this is dank! A little banana
Stark rauchige von Anfang bis Ende

Cijfer: 7,5
Proefnotities: 
Soort Ardbeg light. Een Ardbeg zonder de volheid en scherpte die we van Ardbeg gewend zijn.
Wel heel even de aanzet tot een volle aanwezigheid op de tong. Maar blijft niet lang hangen.

Nose: vanilla, peat and some bacon upfront and some sort of tarmac comes through. The taste starts with sweet vanilla a distinct alcohol burn takes you to a metal youthfulness and a bitter smokey finish which is a sprinter and fades very quickly. Only a unpleasant bitterness sticks to your mouth for quite some time. The balance of this whisky is rather off and all in all it is by far not my favourite dram. Not recommended.
1/10. review is correct. tastes like rubber. not peat. no better with water

This was my first ever scotch...ever, and I liked it from the start. I should have reviewed this eons ago, but I forgot all about it. It was in a bar, and I decided it was time to try scotch. I ordered a flight that started with Glenmorangie 10, then it when to the Isle of Jura 10, and finished with this... glass. Starting with the Glenmorangie 10, I was happy that it wasn't corn liquor (I hate bourbon), but it wasn't anything interesting to me. The Isle of Jura was a *tad* different, but it was more of the same. When I tried this nectar, something happened. I literally said to myself, "There is something about this I love, but I have no earthly idea what it is". Obviously back then, I had no idea what peat or smoke was, or tasted like, but it was the only the beginning. From that day forward, I asked every liquor store if they had a bottle of (esss-lay), which was a pretty sad pronunciation. I've come a long way. I'll be popping a bottle of Bunnahabhain Ceobanech in a day or two.

Trad.Reverso: Smokehead est autant un whisky de classique Islay que la Diligence est un film occidental classique. Le nez est un rossé de tourbe consistante(de viande) - tout le caoutchouc brûlé et des traces de dérapage sur le goudron. Mais ces lourds arômes sont toute la conversation et aucune action. Ils s'effondrent sur eux quand vous prenez une petite gorgée. Le palais - qui est disorientingly crémeux - est un désordre fragile de poivre blanc salin, attrayant et la vanille, qui s'intensifie avec quelques gouttes d'eau. Cette vanille, cependant, est entravée dans à la fin par le lourd de poivre(poivron), la fin(finition) d'algue-y. "
Smoke, smoke and more smoke. Not much else to it.

2017 
Smoky very but not to much peat ... nice in winter beside a fire

This is a NAS whisky that wants to be a Laphroaig really badly but tries to market itself as something different and "hip".  For the price I would rather have a Laphroaig 10 Year.  If it were about $20 bucks cheaper then it would be worth it.  Now, don't get me wrong it is a good tasting, heavy peaty dram, but the value for content just isn't there.

Maybe this lacks finesse, but isn't that the whole point?

This may not deserve a 5-star, BUT it definitely does not deserve the trash review it has to date!

The scotch is impressive in nose, big time ash tray, and the taste to follow is an Islay oil fire, scorching the shore, as the nearby metal music festival patrons destroy nearby houses and the local rick-house to drink the stuff and add the wooden pieces to the massive shoreline bonfire.
A little peaty, but not bad
4yr at Rye with Crystal. Light with easy finish
VERY Smokey nose, tastes and finish surprisingly tame

I’m disappointed in the low ratings on board this site. I think this bottle is excellent for what it is. An intensely smoky and salty, hits big on the pallet, scotch. The ideal affordable replacement for Laphroaig, Lagavulin, and Ardbeg. I’d give it 4 stars, but in efforts to increase the overall ratings, 5 stars it is!

Nose: peated medicinal saltyness. Pronounced burnt rubber. Iodine. 

Taste: sweet at the start. Hits the back of the throat with alcohol exhaust. 
Very short and sweet start before disappearing into acrid burnt tire smoke. 

Not a fan.
Un bon fumé, iode et salé légèrement. Excellent rapport qualité prix. Pas essayer avec de l'eau. Fait par le distilleur de Ardbeg.
These folks are on to non-standard taste profiles - salty smoke with a weird lingering after taste, I actually like it, though I feel I may be betraying my other Islay favorites
Dry, sharp peat. Cough syrup sweetness

That smell when you've been standing next to a bonfire for too long. 

It's alright.
not a bad peated whisky, when tasted could taste hints of toffee, mandarin skin, ash, charcoal, smoke is quite strong, seaweed or sea salt. could drink but find it very strong with salinity.

Creamy on the palate, briny and smokey finish

Not bad, but I wouldn't go out of my way to find it again.

Just the right amount of smoke...not the big bomb that you can still taste two days later with a fervent belch, but not so thin you doubt it’s Islay origins.  Really doesn’t do much sitting on the palate, it’s not until the swallow that it really begins to open and is rich, nice cereal and almond with a touch of peach and vanilla.  This is a nice and easy sipper.
Kedelig peated whisky. Kun smag af malt og røg.
God røg, let eftersmag, forsvinder hurtigt,
Nice and Smokey but not smooth 3 out of 5

Nose: Seaweed, brine and smoke.

Palate: Smoky, fruity and sweet.

Finish: Short, sweet and fruity.

This is not a complex whisky bursting with nuance. It is a very young spirit painted from a limited palette, however what is there is of a high caliber and enjoyable.

The profile is simple rather than elegant, but harsh criticism of this whisky misses the point. It's not trying to be Lagavulin 12 year - it is a very young, crisp and basic peated whisky that would be fantastic as a mixer but can still stand up to neat tasting (well, maybe add a good big hunk of ice).

It is rather like a young Ardbeg but I can't imagine they produce enough spirit to have any spare to sell to bargain level independent bottlers. Most likely its a young Caol Ila, but who knows? What is certain is that the official rating here of 69 is ridiculous. This is a fine, reasonably priced, young workhorse single malt worth at least the same rating as a mid-shelf blend.

"Average" : 2.5 stars
Peaty, but there is a bit more going on some spice and sea salt
Sweet, heavy peat, moss, earth, salt, spice and aged fruit

January 2, 2019 at Darby’s Gastown in Vancouver. Served in a tasting glass. 
Big peat notes and vanilla and caramel assault the nose. Big if not subtle. 
On the palate the peat is much subdued. More pronounced on the palate are the vanilla and caramel with suggestions of fruit and oak.
Despite the stingy curated review by what's her name, I like it a lot. ☺

- banana cream
- ripe pear
- salty
- fruity (not citrus) 
- milk chocolate 
- gas exhaust finish

Aug 8, 2019 at Darby's Gastown in Vancouver. Color is medium amber.  Obviously smoky, somewhat briny on the nose, but complexity is thin, as in lacking. Alcohol burn up front, and some of the promise of the nose, but again a bit thin. Very palatable, but eminently forgettable. Not the most memorable whiskey ever, but not to be disdained altogether. On a scale of 1 to 100 I'd give this about 60. All she wrote..
Heavy smoke on the nose. But not much on the palate. Thin. Meh.

It has a very full nose with lots of peat smoke and some briney notes as well. The smoke and brine translate well on the palate with a surprisingly smooth mouth feel. I tried a bit of the Ardbeg An Oa shortly after and found that the Smoke Head is actually a bit smokier than the Ardbeg although not as refined. It does appear that the Smoke Head my have some colour added as it is quite a bit darker than the Ardbeg but it is a very good budget priced Islay noetheless. To my taste it seems a little more similar to Laphroaig than Ardbeg but I quickly admit that I do not have the most refined palate for picking out those subtle nuances and did not have any Laphraoig on hand to really compare. To sum it all up, if you are a fan of smoke and don’t want to break the bank on filling that void Smoke head is a good buy. It is leaps and bounds ahead of Islay Mist and Mclelland’s Islay even if it doesn’t have some of the class of the primary Islay producers.
Enjoying this, packs a punch but doesn't linger.

Enkel, men fin nese. Mangler litt i ganen. trenger gjerne mer aroma.ettersmak forsvant fort. Åpner seg mer etter 8-10 dråper vann. Også mer hav- og tangpreget nese. Ganske fantastisk etter litt tilsetting av vann. Dog fortsatt litt kortvarig ettersmak.
Pour yourself a glass of peat.
Meaty peat aroma. Meaty peat flavor with some salt and seaweed notes. Lighter, creamy, albeit short, finish.
Peaty smoke, but not a punch to the head. Touch of oiliness. Laphroaig and Caol Ila? Not a huge finish but a pleasant easy peat drinker

Does what it intends very smoky and ashy. Lacks in complexity, but if you like just smoke it scratches that itch.
When you add water it turns more ashy. Overall nice whisky.
Very smokey and extremely heavy on the peat. Smokey aftertaste lasts quite a while after each sip. Overall, a good smokey scotch!
Very good whiskey for the price. Very smoky but a little on the spicy side. Very smooth though.
Predominantly smoke, vanilla and licorice. Not bad.
Peat, peat, and then some more peat.
Smokey with a hint of sweetness followed buy a perfect burn
This flavour at this price point, even if it is a bit bacon-y makes this a 4
Smoky and a bit peaty. Smooth and warm with a bit of spice
ikke helt en favoritt etter en caol ila
Litt rar lukt. Smaker godt, da. Tørr. Smak forsvinner forholdsvis fort.
The "VB of peats"! Wow. Strong peat and smoke from nose through to intense finish. Mild sour cherry finish right at end. No class. Dirty. Smokey.
Likte ikke lukten veldig mye i starten. hjalp med 10 dråper vann. Smakte bedre enn den luktet. Veldig mye peat. snev av sjø. Gjør seg best etter tilsatt vann.
Tang og tare. Oppbrent bål. En liten kvist med granbar.
